alert.note: Alert for Berkeley (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 06 at 6:28PM EDT until May 06 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EDT FOR PORTIONS OF BERKELEY COUNTY... At 626 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Gourdin to near Bonneau Beach, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...The South Carolina Highway patrol reported trees down on I- 26 with these storms. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. Locations impacted include: Saint Stephen, Bonneau, Eadytown, Cross, Northern Lake Moultrie, Bonneau Beach and Eastern Lake Marion. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so.
